title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 5 april [1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 5 April [1870]
text: 5 April 1870BrooklynAprilApril 5 My dear Walti have just received your letter and the order all safe am glad to hear you are better of your cold am glad walterWalter dear itsit's in your power to deal so generously to your mother)i am rather better of my lameness now i was very lame for a week or so we have so much easterly winds that makes me worse helen price has been here to day she comes from the office has just gone)George has been home he went away yesterday mondayMonday he wontwon't come come again if nothing happens till the 1 of mayMay i had a letter from mattyMatty too she says Jeffy is coming to pittsburghPittsburgh this week she didentdidn't know but he would come to brooklynBrooklyn i thought probably he would after hearing of poor jesseJesse death i doodo wish the doctor would write something about the poor unfortunates death it would be some consolation to heargood bie walterWalter deari have also written to hannaHannah i found some envelopes directed to you walterWalter Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 5 April [1870]
